Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: A slender plumwood tube with a set of seven finger holes which is flared at one end with a mouth piece at the other end that is blown into. It has been engraved with an ivory open book surrounded by three seashells.

A slender plumwood tube with several finger holes which is flared at one end with a mouth piece at the other end that is blown into. It has been engraved with an ivory open book surrounded by three seashells.
The recorder's body is a slender hollow wooden tube meant to be held to the side of the head with the mouthpiece placed between the lips.
The recorder's body is a slender hollow wooden tube slightly flared at one end mouthpiece placed between the lips.
A set of seven finger holes are placed evenly along the body of the recorder with a single thumb hole placed in the bottom to change the pitch of the notes.
A set of finger holes along the top of the instrument including a thumb hole placed upon the bottom below the mouthpiece.
A hole in the end of the recorder meant to be placed between the lips and blown into.
A hole in the end of the recorder meant to be placed between the lips and blown into.
